title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4B: `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4: `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory`, but has no comparisons.

short.value: Past list of status codes (the current status may be included to cover the start date of the status)

definition.value: The history of statuses that the EpisodeOfCare has been through (without requiring processing the history of the resource).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled | entered-in-error

definition.value: planned | waitlist | active | onhold | finished | cancelled.

requirements.value: Element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory.status` is part of an existing definition because parent element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory` requires a cross-version extension. Element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory.status` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `EpisodeOfCare.statusHistory.status`, but has no comparisons.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
